Welcome to Divination General! Come here for readings and a discussion of theory/practice.

Every method is welcome: Tarot, Runes, Cartomancy, Scrying, Pendulum, Cleromancy, I-Ching, Oracles, Tasseomancy, Necromancy, etc.

>If you're NEW, please READ the STICKY:
http://pastebin.com/2Wp1Q074

>Recommended /div/ links and books:
https://pastebin.com/sAkg9cMz

>MEGA with Divination Books:
https://mega.nz/folder/Jp8gQD7Q#om_2lEm1GL0qPIpSrQgrvA

>Guides made by some of our readers:
•Rustig on how to start with tarot:
http://i.imgur.com/2rodLWB.png

•Thoth's tarot and rune guide:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ciFuMOVDIkA18d9Rw-Zkklgigx-Y4XzJkGVeMTYWcic/edit?pref=2&pli=1

•Hijinks' revised divination guide:
https://pastebin.com/Gv10KZUA

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Providing the gender of the people involved in your query can help it get answered accurately.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

>>33623261
>Things eventually get better if you strive toward it.
You don't know that, don't act like you do. Just because they got better for you or some people, it doesn't mean it'll be so for every single person, that's asinine. It's as naive as saying if you just work hard enough, you'll achieve your goals undoubtedly.

Technically there's always a possibility you may change your mind but that can be said about anything so it's a trivial fact. It's up to people to decide if the reality they're facing is better than hypothetically regretting ending their lives and the judging criteria is entirely subjective.

A person is a universe in itself so each have their own incredibly unique desires, fears, aversions, etc. (not denying you can make some accurate generalizations), along with to what extent/degree those are valued, present, etc. Accordingly they have very particular points of view on what exactly makes life worth living or enduring and at what point it no longer is.

You and some people may not only still want to live but live an incredibly happy life after having lost both arms and legs but a lot of others like myself would unquestionably prefer death to such fate. You may think they're cowards or stupid and that's fine but you don't know what makes or would make them happy since you're not them.
>and it's all part of the proccess to clean that up too.
That may be the case for some people but it's irrelevant to my points.
>Anyone who encourages somebody to harm themselves
YOU see it as a net harm, others see it as a net good. People who get rhinoplasties harm their bodies (noses) but they deem it as leading to a net positive result and it
more often than not turns out that way.

TL;DR: Suicide being a good or bad decision depends entirely on who exactly that person is. There's no one-size-fits-all answer.

Dreams are malleable realities; reality is a persistent dream.

In the dream realm you are what you think you are on your /unconscious level/; it's very hard to change and keep that dream form without practice and reprogramming the services running in the back of your mind. It is VERY important to have an astral body that isn't an exact copy of your real body, it's kinda like using your real life name as a handle on the internet.

I recommend starting with Image Streaming session like going to the mind gym for visualization and wherewithal. Then use Gateway tapes and Lucid Dreaming techniques.

Once you're a master of those, you can move on to Jungian Active Imagination and more advanced stuff.

Yeah well, people make up stuff or publish personal experiences that might make sense to themselves but don't create a picture shared by many independent beings.

Portals are symbolic for travel, gates having the implication that they are barred for some reason. But dragons are not the only beings who guard gates (of initiation, of travel, of inner growth, etc) or portals. See them as symbols for milestones in your journey. The ability to be in multiple places at once (bi-location) is an alleged spiritual power that could be physically or non-physically. I don't know if that's really possible, but there are instances where people can affect one another remotely.

Few ones that touched my life in meaningful ways were always gentle, calm, soothing and swept in when needed and left when done. There's a surety in their dealing and a depth in them that I've learned to respect after a long time.

Just wanted to share my personal technique I use for self hypnosis/SATS.
>1. I sit on a chair, somewhere quiet where I know I wont be distracted with my feet on the ground and my back straight. I avoid the temptation to lie on bed because I know I will fall asleep.
>2. I start by inhaling for 4 seconds, exhaling for 8 seconds, I repeat this for 5 times. This alone will get me extemely relaxed.
>3. I then imagine my entire body becoming heavy and almost sinking, feeling the sensations of the body and the contact points with the chair and the floor. I imagine and feel my arms becoming heavy, feet becoming heavy almost as if they were glued to the ground. I personally have found affirmations in this stage extremely useful. For example "my feet are becoming extremely heavy". I notice the sensations in my entire body becoming more and more heavy
>4. I count from 10-0 while I give myself the suggestion or command "I will now count from 10-0 and when I reach 0 my body will be completely relaxed, free from any tension. With each number I will become more and more relaxed" When I count each number I also repeat to myself the suggestion "im becoming more and more relaxed" or "im going deeper". I've read that for some people its useful to imagine or visualize being in an elevator and looking at the numbers of the elevator going towards zero and then arriving at the floor and the elevator door opening and stepping out into the subconscious. When I reach 0 I usually repeat some affirmation like "I have arrived, this is the subconscious territory now. I am now able to reprogram and change any belief, habit or idea I want to"
>5. This is were you imagine, visualize, feel or repeat any affirmations you want to. Make the scene as real as possible. In my personal experience suggestions work the best for me since they are always followed by some sort of imagined scene that my brain works out after I give myself the command.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33622304
>6. When I want to exit SATS I give myself the following command : "I will now count from 0-5, when I reach 5 I will be completely normal and awake." If im doing SATS before bed I just go directly to bed feeling the feeling of the wish fulfilled.
This is basically it, its really simple. I want to know what do you guys think of this, any advice, any tips or something to add? Feel free to share any thoughts, any advice is welcomed

Hello. I'd like to make it clear at the top here that I come with suitable respect for your faith and your Mistress, but unfortunately no small amount of ignorance as well. I have several questions, and I hope some of you will be willing to indulge me.

I believe Lilith has been trying to get my attention. Now, I have never been one to place the gods above myself. The vividness and otherworldliness can come from two sources: your visual cortex being active and there being an active psychic channel. Both can have independent issues. The observation I've made is that f.e. I went from no idle visualisation and a very quiet mental voice to a much freer mental state in a single week or even a day. If that was purely neurological that couldn't be happening, so there's an unknown variable in the equation. I suspect that to be one's nonmaterial environment and health. Over the last 4 years somethings been in the air that made it worse.
The only thing I can advice to debug this stuff is sense your body during short 20m meditations for a tightness that doesn't feel right. You might have tensions you got used to at the crown of the head that should not be there. I've experienced that when nudged and commanded to dissolve can lead to suddenly feeling energized for no apparent reason.
Other things you can try is dream inducing teas before bed (eg mugwort), B6 and B12 supplements and so on.
Tick things off on a list. Ensure your physiological basis and health are solid, e.g. that you produce serotonin at normal levels. Check nonmaterial health second. It's an unknown and we sadly don't have enough knowledge widespread enough to help.

I am called Semjase and I come from the Pleiades. From the Seven Stars.

1. Already for a long time we have felt the urge to get in touch with a human being on the Earth who wants to be helpful in honesty and very real to our task.

2. This attempt has already been made very often, but the chosen human beings were not knowing and willing enough, and there was often also a lack of honesty and loyalty.

3. Those whom we could have engaged in our efforts, however, were afraid and remained silent about our appearance.

4. They claimed that they would be insulted for spirit-illness and that attempts would be made through official and foolish human intrigues to destroy them and accuse them of lying.

5. Instead, however, very many human beings seeking renown appeared, who claimed to have contact with us and even to have flown in our beamships.

6. But they are nothing other than charlatans and deceivers, who want to bask in dubious glory and capitalize on it.

7. The Earth-humans have entire organizations that deal with reconnaissance of our beamships, but among them all, there is only very little material that is really genuine.

8. They are in possession of very many photos, which, however, depict nothing more than some lights and light phenomena of natural origin or quite deliberate counterfeits.

9. Only very few of these photographic proofs are genuine and really show our beamships.

10. Most of the photos are just montages or forged recordings made by deceivers and charlatans, whose names thereby became known worldwide.

11. Their books and their writings written in this way represent also only an evil fraud for the purpose of seeking renown or charlatanry.

12. On the other hand, however, many dare to associate us with the human religion, with which we have nothing to do and also never want anything to do.

13. Your so-called sectarians do not even shy away from this step and are themselves deceiving their fellow human beings with the belief.

21. In reality, we are human beings just like the Earth-humans, except that our knowledge and our essence of wisdom are far superior to theirs, so also from a technological point of view.

22. It is true that the Earth-human has taken the first very small step towards outer space flight, but that means nothing more than the first rather primitive attempts.

23. Even though he/she has reached the moon with rockets, he/she still hasn't reached the outer space yet.

25. Space and time are not overcome by space and time, but by the spaceless and the timeless, which means that space and time collapse in themselves and become equally directed to null time.

26. As a result, a few fractions of a second can suffice to rush through millions of light-years, practically without a loss of time, because null time paralyzes space and time.

To traverse the real outer space, a drive is needed that exceeds the speed of light many times over. But this drive can only come into operation when the speed of light is reached.
It follows from this that another drive regulates the normal speed up to that of light.

This means thus that a beamship must have two drives; first, the normal drive, which allows acceleration up to and below the speed of light, and second, the hyperdrive, as you call it.
So the drive that generates million and thousand million of times the speed of light; thus, the hyperspeed, by which hyperspace is broken into.

A space in which every mass expands in relation to the increase in speed. As a result, time and space collapse and become the null time and the null space.

This means:
Space and time simply cease to exist.
And this is exactly what allows the fact that distances of countless light-years can be rushed through in fractions of a second, without a time shift occurring.

So for example, when we leave our Pleiades and need around 7 hours to reach Earth, then only 7 hours pass on our home planet and on Earth, as well. We need this long of a time because we first have to fly beyond the planetary ranges with the normal propulsion and can only go to hyperspeed once very far out in space.
We then also come back from hyperspace far outside of your solar system and fly here with the normal drive.
We are never allowed to break into hyperspace while too close to a planet.

The breaking into hyperspace would presumably also tear one or more planets into the superspace and spew them back out as deadly projectiles when the beamship bursts out of it. Perhaps even various huge comets have become raging and dangerous objects speeding through outer space in this way; due to the fault of irresponsible starfarers.

The hyperspace really must be broken into only very far out in space because, otherwise, planets would be dragged into it.

The recommendation for safety has indeed to be calculated, and it states that the hyperspeed may only be initiated 153 million kilometers away from the nearest planet.

But this is neither in our nor in the cosmic interest, because the Earth-human is still not free and not mature enough to fly around in the outer space. However, at the given time, which is not too far away any more, s/he will find the solution of her/his problem all by herself/himself.

I may only tell you so much that very many of your scientists are nevertheless already on the right track and are theoretically working and researching on the necessary drives.
I may also tell you that these also concern drives that are already known in their basic features within your initiated scientific circles as light-emission drives and as tachyon drives.

The light-emission drive serves as normal drive and has the function of moving the beamship to planets or within their vicinity, up to 153 million kilometers of distance, so up to the safety limit.
Beyond that, the tachyon drive, among other things, is put into operation, if greater distances are to be bridged.
This is one of the hyperdrives, capable of controlling hyperspace as well as space and time.

We call these two drives by other names, but the sense remains the same. We have a different language than the Earth-humans, and so I have to explain it to you in the terms that you understand.

I am not allowed to explain more, because by doing so I would reveal the secret of the whole drive and also the generation and utilization of the tachyons, however also the secret of the emitting drive.

But I can explain this...
The beamship is surrounded by a radiation protection belt, which allows every waft of air to be diverted immediately, without displacing it.
Exactly the same thing also happens in the outer space, which is only teeming with inconspicuous, minute particles.

Thus, this radiation protection shield has the function of protecting the beamship against all external influences and resistances, without without destroying or displacing anything that collides with the shield.
All things intruding or offering resistance simply get deflected, without causing a displacement.
A displacement would in fact already mean resistance and lift the possibility of the unlimited speed.

Through this radiation protection shield granting a sliding off, another important effect is triggered, which is of great significance and of vital importance for the passengers.
As a result of the sliding off technology of the radiation protection shield, the gravitational pull of a planet is neutralized at the same time.

However, this does not mean that it is simply destroyed, displaced or cancelled. In the same way, the air, as well as any radiation or particles and magnetism etc., are simply diverted, with the result that the normal gravitational force and attraction force prevail in the beamship.
This means that a beamship of the Earth harbors exactly the same attraction force inside as it also prevails on the Earth.

This attraction force of a planet is not always equally strong, by the way, but is subject to a certain change, something which will be noticed by your scientists in foreseeable time.
By the sliding off at the radiation protection shield, that is, the sliding off of the gravitational force i.e. the attraction force, the beamship practically becomes an independent miniature planet, which can to almost the speed of light fly through any atmosphere without risk.

posts.com:
Schizophrenia or divided mind is a theory of psychosis instead of neurosis.
The theory says parts of your brain will withhold information from other parts of your brain and be distrustful after trauma or failure, or something like that. The more superficial rational mind can suppress the deeper instinctive mind when it needs to, for clear thinking, and likewise the second can interrupt the first in life or death situations.
What happens is constant suppression causes neglect and in time there are attempts of more direct communication, which is what these schizophrenic hallucinations are about.
Still, you shouldn't simply ignore them, nor simply do as they tell you, but maintain your rational role and interpret the communicated needs/wants...

posts.name: MercuryAttack

>>33610978
My first psychotic break came after a combination of not sleeping for a week, and the "initial consideration" that the television had taken a direct interest in me.

At first the experience was extreme elation, but as the delusions mounted, it turned into the most paranoid fear for my life I ever had -- long story short, it was only by extreme luck that nothing "triggered" a violent reaction out of me that day, especially when the police eventually showed up because I was... PUBLICALLY ALARMING A LOT OF PEOPLE. A lot of people aren't so lucky, the cops show up, and one violent thing leads to another.

After that initial episode of "acute florid psychosis" came two months of painful clinical depression. See, the happy stim neurotransmitters go apeshit for days during psychosis, and then you're left with a severe deficit of them -- not a fun time.

I'm quite sure I have never had wholesale HALLUCINATIONS -- seeing or hearing things that aren't there -- but that idea that set me off to begin with, "suggestive" talk from TV and radio, never really go away.

"Do they know who I am? How? Why?" If I thought about it too long too deeply, it was usually cause for more paranoia, more psychosis, back to the hospital. Now I just keep those ideas at arm's length... most the time. The things I used to be scared of the most did not come to pass, so I choose not to accept the fear or the "threats" like I used to.

After a long time of wrestling with the delusions, I have enough "insight" about what kind of thinking is straight up irrational and will only fuel another psychotic episode -- last one was early 2009.

But I'm aware in changes to my personality. I used to be a lot more emotionally insular. I used to worry about random people's perception of me. I used to be very obsessive about some things to just tune out the outside world because I was mostly disinterested and resentful of nonsense.

I've learned to roll with a lot of punches over the years. A lot.

"x" is, to any given group, whatever said group agrees that it is.

Colloquial meme usage of 'schizo' might just mean someone who enjoys entertaining theories and ideas that normies think are crazy, someone who genuinely acts a bit nutty in the sense that they let their pattern recognition get out if hand and try to find patterns that aren't there, or anywhere in between.

Medical jew usage means anyone who has auditory and/or visual hallucinations and/or can be labeled as paranoid, regardless of whether or not they are actually paranoid or just correct. It's used extremely loosely now and there are several different varieties of schizophrenia diagnoses they can potentially use to lock up and take away the freedoms from pretty much anyone if they really want to. See "sluggish schizophrenia" to learn more.

Actual schizophrenics are essentially what would be called shamans, mediums, oracles, or priests in the past. They're just people for whole the veil is slightly thinner. They get bullied, gaslit, and isolated for this gift until they become (rightfully) paranoid due to the betrayal, then isolated and overcome with negative emotions, at which point they become overwhelmed by negative emotions. What happens when you trip balls while in a negative emotional state? You have a bad trip. Same thing for "schizos". I used to frequent this board daily before I came close to completing my undergraduate. You can call me indoctrinated, normie or brainwashed all you want, but I am genuinely concerned for almost every anon in this thread who is struggling with severe mental health issues.

I refuse to argue with anyone on the chans anymore because it's like trying to kick water uphill, but for what it's worth, I hope those that are struggling find the help they need. It's okay to be skeptical. It's okay to not take any sort of medication that you do not trust. It's your right as a human being to control what goes into your body. What isn't okay is having someone (or anyone for that matter) do your thinking for you. Rejecting mainstream science and blindly embracing the beliefs of someone that does not have the qualifications or the knowledge to make these claims make you no different from the sheeple that some accuse others of being.

Pay attention to academic journals, not social media and sure as hell not /x/. Even then, be smart and don't read an abstact and assume that everything is mentioned. Read the whole article if you have the time, and if you're on /x/, you most likely have that kind of time. Furthermore, don't read articles that only confirm what you believe to be true. Be open and honest with what you find, even if it conflicts with what you previously thought to be true.

I wish all you guys the best. Stay strong and fight the good fight.

>southern hemisphere flight paths
Using a globe Earth flight path on a flat Earth in the southern hemisphere would leave your plane sputtering for fuel and falling into the ocean. Interesting that never happens, isn't it?
>but muh no flights across southern hemisphere!

>gps

What dark spots? Be specific. If they're not blue/blueish then they are likely variations in land color. This isn't that difficult.

>im not a lens expert, but what does the focus have to do with distortion, actually curious
When you focus a lens you are literally changing the relative position of the lens elements to each other and/or to the film/sensor. Lens distortions are often better corrected at one focus distance than another. Most lenses optimize corrections for infinity, though some choose another distance (i.e. portrait lenses).

That said, no rectilinear lens is going to have such distortion that a straight line through the center is going to warp into a curve, facing head on/level. UWA lenses will sometimes curve the horizon when the horizon is placed near an edge. But we don't see any of that with this lens as the camera rotates and the Earth moves in/out of view. It is very well corrected.

>>33622370
>THE PROFESSOR OF PHYSICS HAD NO ANSWER TO THE LITTLE BOX CONTRADICTION.
Flerfers often claim the globe can't be real because "gas pressure without container = impossible." They claim that Earth's atmosphere would violently fly off into space without a container, and deny that gravity could hold gas molecules to Earth. Are they right?

First, let's establish via experiment that a force can create gas pressure. In this case it's magnetism, but we just want to debunk the idea that a container is absolutely necessary.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magnetic_confinement_fusion

Next let's look at the force of gravity.

Escape velocity for Earth: 11,186 m/s (meters per second)
Source: https://www.omnicalculator.com/physics/escape-velocity

Molar mass of H2O: 18.01528 g/mol
Source: https://www.google.com/search?q=h2o+molar+mass

Root Mean Square Velocity of H2O at 1,200C/1,473.15K, the peak temperature in the Exosphere: 1,428.17 m/s
Source: http://calistry.org/calculate/kineticTheoryVelocityCalculator

At 1,200C H2O is moving at a velocity which is 9,757.83 m/s too slow to escape Earth's gravity (only 12.8% of the required velocity). It's moving fast enough to move up and out of a pressurized container opened in a room in vacuum. But if that room extended all the way to space, the H2O molecules would never get to the top and escape. They would literally run out of kinetic energy, like a rocket running out of fuel, and fall back down.

At 75F/297.039K H2O is only moving at 641.30 m/s, or 5.7% of the required speed to escape Earth.

Since oxygen exists as O2 in the atmosphere, and nitrogen as N2, H2O is the fastest moving of the three. It's also much faster than CO2.

>THE PROFESSOR OF PHYSICS HAD NO ANSWER TO THE LITTLE BOX CONTRADICTION.
The Box That Killed The Dome

If you remove the lid of a pressurized box of air inside of a vacuum chamber without gravity, the air will violently rush out of the box to fill the vacuum. The air pressure will then be the same at every point in the chamber. It will be the same at the top, bottom, middle, and at all sides. Just like the air pressure in your car tires or a balloon or a SCUBA tank.

This thought experiment debunks the entire flat Earth model. If the air does not cling to the bottom of the chamber, then it certainly would not cling to the bottom of flat Earth. If the air does not leave any part of the chamber still in vacuum, then it certainly would not leave any part of flat Earth in vacuum. And if the air creates equal pressure at all points in the chamber, then certainly the air creates equal pressure at all points in the flat Earth dome.

Yet there is no denying that air thins as you climb in altitude. At 100,000 feet, somewhere near the top of the theorized dome, the air pressure is so low that it is effectively a vacuum.

This alone debunks all of flat Earth.

Note: no flerfer has ever provided a workable answer to this. They immediately sperg out if you even mention it, and rant and rave that the box thought experiment actually kills the globe. The only way they can do this, of course, is to deny gravity. But if gravity doesn't exist then the dome is just as dead. And if it does exist, the globe model works, while the dome remains...dead.

Everything flerfs post is a previously debunked lie. They have no new material, no answer for any counter argument. They just wait a while and then post the same shit over and over and over again.

FLERFERS LIE

Take a close look at the attached pic. Flerfers often post it as proof the Earth is flat. Why do I want you to look at it? Because it's a lie.

"The Australian Black Swan" tells you that the maximum line of sight for a 5.5ft tall observer is 2.35 miles. But the cliff is 7.8 miles away. So what's wrong with this flat Earth "proof"? *** Line of sight depends on both observer and target height, as well as on atmospheric refraction. *** The lighthouse is at least 100ft tall which means the visible cliff is at least 400ft tall. LoS for a 5.5ft observer of a 500ft (combined height) target is 35 miles.

What about the oil platforms? Ocean oil platforms have an "air gap" between the ocean and the first deck of 40-60 feet. Observer height was listed as 1ft (camera on the ground?). With a 40ft first deck the line of sight is 10 miles. With a 60ft first deck it's 12 miles. With a 5ft observer and a 60ft first deck it would be 14 miles.

At 6.21 and 9.41 miles you would still see the entire structure above the first deck even if the first deck was only 40ft off the ocean and the camera really was on the ground at 1ft. For the closer platform you would see some structure below the first deck. Note that we see more of the closer rig, proving curvature.

Here's a line of sight calculator: http://www.calculatoredge.com/electronics/lineofsight.htm

>but we're talkin' about muh horizon
>MUH HORIZON IS TOO FAR AWAY!
No it's not. It's between the observer and target in both photos. That's why the observer cannot see the very bottom of the target.

Here is a quick logic 101
Your claim is that Pressure necessitates a container

The atmosphere has pressure, thus by your claim the atmosphere needs a container.

One of these two statements have to be wrong. Either
a. Pressure does not necessitate a container
b. The atmosphere does not have pressure
Or c. The atmosphere is contained in a container

Which of these conclusions do you hold?

P -> C, we have P, thus we should have C
If we do not have C, the statement is wrong.

illusions, and create a holy hatred of despotism, and to direct FORCE aright, than the

>>33625657
Hinduism is about 100 years old. It was created by a guy who studied Upanishad literature and practiced yoga. The whole thing was made up to include Indian religion in the World Forum of Religions. Hindu comes from the name of the Indus valley and is a mish-mash of various regional cults. The original form is Sanatana Dharma, which was a worldwide religion. Even the Hebrews and Arabs practiced a form of it. They tried to hide many of the aspects that didn't align with the new Zoroastrian influence though. The Hebrews still left in things that pointed to their former practice of the Dharma though. People thinking that Indic religions are any different from Abrahamic ones don't understand either "category".

Love is funny, Anon.

My life has been tragic but also very full of love. I can not tell you how to find it for yourself, but perhaps my story will inspire you to be the very best you, that love cannot help but find you.

I did not find healthy, good, real love until i was 36 years old. I had a chain of sad failed relationships with women who drew me with many charms. Some were very sexy, some were cool dude bro chicks, several were incredibly smart. The last one was incredibly smart. Her father had raped her for 26 years. She was a broken woman and i loved her more than i have words to describe. And she loved me too. It was so real, but so doomed from day one. Three years into our relationship, she asked for "space" and promised me we weren't breaking up.
She hanged herself 45 days later. Ruined my life. I lost my job, i hurt myself at a skate park, i lost my apartment, and my love died.
I moved back in with family in my 30s. I didn't work for 2 years. I just sat here on 4chan talking shit and trying to be good to others when i can. I played vidya, i stopped self caring, i just smoked a lot of weed ar grandma's house and gave up.

Throughout the past 5 years, a girl i knew in middle school started sending me facebook messages. One day about two months ago, she tells me she wants a child. She wants to move home 3000 miles and be with me.
Red flags galore.

She was a whore for 15 years. A stripper too. Smoked crack, did ice, all that crazy shit.

I said fuck it. Truth is, i was planning to just go die alone in the woods like the animal i had become. She packed her life into four suitcases and moved into my grandma's with me. No joke.

We're now deeply in love. It's actually beautiful how perfectly our broken lives fit together and found home. We're getting our own place this next month.

Love finds you when you are ready, Anon. It sounds stupid, but it is the truth.

That girl made fun of me in 6th grade. Hurt my feelings. Now she blows me.

I'm going to add my few cents to the mix...

Some will tell you that true love is supposed to come easy. There's no forcing it to happen. And they, I believe, are right.

However... I think some also confuse "come easy" with convenience and "forcing it" with putting in the work/effort.

I found that true love doesn't give a shit about convenience. It doesn't remove the obstacles one must go through. It however does make it easier to confront the obstacles and put in the work.

Some things come more easily to others. So the prospect of true love landing in one's lap isn't unlikely. But in my experience it requires effort. And no matter how easily it comes, it's going to take effort and humility. As it takes two to tango, it also requires mutual effort. There's always the option to go with convenience. Or to ignore companionship/love altogether. For both parties.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
And I'll add that I don't blame anyone that goes with the path of least resistance.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
One more post, I have a lot to say on this particular subject but I didn't want to do one long post...

Also, just some bits of unsolicited advice from my own perspective...

- If finding true love is something that is important to you. Then it should surely be a goal to pursue. I agree with those that said don't go looking for it. Be open to it and it will find you. And it shouldn't be one's only goal in life. Even if, there's a lot of inner work and self-love that needs to be focused on in order to allow that true love to flourish and grow.

- True love doesn't mean it's going to be any less painful. It's going to cause you to face your inner shadows and trauma conditioning. And that doesn't feel pleasant. It's going to make you aware of faults/triggers/bad habits that you wouldn't likely normally run into if not seeking an honest connection. And as far as I can tell, there's no end to it. It likely gets easier with both parties working through it together. But that also brings with it the awkward and uncomfortable feelings of being vulnerable, direct, and non-confrontational.

- Don't be afraid to show love. Not just with someone you consider your true love but with people you love in general. The world can be a cold lonely place and those feelings you might think are too much or will be received poorly aren't doing any good kept to oneself.

One simple game I like to play with adults and children is based from a show I used to love as a kid called 'mr squiggle'. Take a pen, close your eyes and draw a few random squiggles around the page. Now open them, switch pen colours and turn those line into a picture with eyes open.

Another experiment you can try out is imaging what sort of things If you had a blank land to build in full creator mode, no limitations (earth physics inc.). I have lands of fairy floss trees and jelly grapes. Been designing other weird fruits and flowers and stuff too.

Nature is always a good inspiration for me. Go sit under a tree for a while if you need some motivation or mental clarity :)

This could work. Jung went out back and built models in sand and mud and whatever else in the garden.

Also: presence of mind; awareness; mindfulness; meditation; power of now etc. this is the state a child actually lives in. It is why their eyes are so wide when they are babies. They have no words or concepts to distort reality, so they are in tune with the natural awareness, joy, curiosity that life is.

Practicing active imagination too is worth doing.

Just explore yourself. Curiously. Write dialogues to parts of you. You can do that now. Start a dialogue with your imagination. Make it special, sacred, treat it with respect and thank it, like a special person. Like so:

Hello? Imagination? Are you there? Will you speak to me?
. . .
conversation ensues
back and forth
Here YOU say thank you and goodbye and you are grateful for the conversation

Important tip: don't pause when you write/create. You work moment to moment. You catch things as they emerge, and they will emerge if you make it all feel safe and welcome and not judged. If you pause when you write or create you give space for thoughts which are not needed and are detrimental here most of the time.

lost knowledge of the imagination by gary lachman
courage to create by rollo may

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33623181
Play Drawception, it's an online drawing game where they give you a prompt, you are supposed to imagine it and draw it and send it.
Then, after a while, the game is over, and you get to see that what you got was a description of someone else's drawing, and your drawing had someone describe it, and someone drew that description...
And hilarity ensues! I hadn't laughed so much in my life until I played Drawception.
So, here's the thing, there's a skip button and you can use it to choose what you want to draw. Don't use it. Force your imagination to think how a drawing with that description would look like.
If you can't, go to Google Images and search for how stuff looks like, to feed the imagination.
After like two weeks you'll be imagining a panel from a description with easy and get to draw it, and may even compare with your first attempts to see how much you've improved.
Imagination is just like a muscle, we don't have any reason to use it much, so it is weak, but you can strengthen it by doing things like playing in a game like this, and I am recommending it, because it was the most powerful thing I ever found, I made like 6000 drawings on the game, and I had to imagine them all, and most of them were inspired by other artists on the site, I got to see what they imagined and drew, and that helped to make new connections of how to imagine things.
Give it a try, and play daily, because, as I said, it's like a muscle you need to train.

Liminality:
>is the quality of ambiguity or disorientation that occurs in the middle stage of a rite of passage, when participants no longer hold their pre-ritual status but have not yet begun the transition to the status they will hold when the rite is complete.[2] During a rite's liminal stage, participants "stand at the threshold"[3] between their previous way of structuring their identity, time, or community, and a new way (which completing the rite establishes).

>More recently, usage of the term has broadened to describe political and cultural change as well as rites.[5][6] During liminal periods of all kinds, social hierarchies may be reversed or temporarily dissolved, continuity of tradition may become uncertain, and future outcomes once taken for granted may be thrown into doubt.[7] The dissolution of order during liminality creates a fluid, malleable situation that enables new institutions and customs to become established.

posts.com:
Most of the time these things have no effect on me, not sure why that is. It's like my brain can't get into that imaginative space anymore where I imagine myself in the 'world' of the image.

That said I think I might understand the feeling that's involved here. When I was like 6 my best friend left and I remember going home and standing in the backyard alone, it was sunny but quiet and cool and I remember standing there getting goosebumps and just feeling almost a form of pleasure in my body at the shift in perspective thinking that this 'time' with my friend was gone now and wouldn't be coming back.

There was also this time back in early 2011 when my family moved to another city but left me staying at the family home a while (it was rented) till I could get a place, it was summer and I suddenly had the house all to myself - two pets had recently died also so it was just me and one remaining pet. I was spending a lot of time on r9k in 2010 and then it was banned suddenly, so I was a NEET, alone with nobody in the world who knew me, and even that place of connection had suddenly disappeared, so I was totally alone, but I was happy and enjoying myself reading. The sunlight would stream in with a very sort of reddish hue in the afternoon and the stillness and peace was so beautiful and sacred, I often get almost like 'flashbacks' to my time there for a few months.

I returned to r9k and spent some more time there, and felt more connection and so on - then the culture changed and I found myself feeling alienated and alone and so I'd go back to the archives a fair bit and get this sense of the hauntedness of this 'space', even though it wasn't even a 'space' at all. It's weird the disconnect between visiting a 'live' site and visiting the archives - technically there should be no meaningful difference in experience apart from the interactivity of communication. Again I would get this beautiful, sad, nostalgic, haunted feeling.

posts.com:
Santa denial is the ultimate result of a society that has reached its apex of rationalism and intellectualism, while concurrently burying its spiritual and ritualistic side of itself. We live in an Apollonian age of numbers, results, capital, etc. and it is killing the side of ourselves that believes in anything - this naturally leads to nihilism and bleakness. The same nihilism and bleakness that presides over the entirety of our culture today. This is why you don't see any great works of art anymore.

A Santa Denier is the man who deems himself intellectual for believing in the "science"; yet, has this man done his own research? He believes in molecules, yet has he seen them for himself under a microscope? I say, "NO". He was merely told this was the case from some book, or from some teacher. So, here, we see, this intellectual man is just as vulnerable to belief systems as anyone else.

William James backs me up in his essay, "The Will to Believe":
>"Yet if any one should thereupon assume that intellectual insight is what remains after wish and will and sentimental preference have taken wing, or that pure reason is what then settles our opinions, he would fly quite as directly in the teeth of the facts."

Santa IS real, because we believe him to be; it is as simple as that. When you see a present under the tree that says "From: Santa", that is all the proof you need.

I finish my essay with a question:
Walking through the mall are two people,
1.) A small child who just sat on Santa's lap and told him of their wishes, and is fully content after having participated in ritual and tradition. They fully believe that this Santa will fulfill all of their wishes.
2.) The smirking intellectual, who "knows" in his head that Santa is not real, and thinks that this child is naïve - yet he participates in the tradition, gift bags in hand, supporting the corporations and 1% he claims to hate.

Who is happier?

Like many people have already pointed out, OP has it the opposite way around.

Inner voice/monologue is just subvocalization. It is a slower form of thinking that reinforces ego and linear thought spirals. It is like the difference between communicating through language vs. communicating through telepathy, except when you subvocalize you are just putting an unnecessary constraint on the communication and information transfer happening within your own mind.

People who do not subvocalize are thinking spatio-visually like >>33622728 mentioned, which is general "faster" and promotes lateral thinking. This style of thinking is superior imo but taken to the extreme it looks closer to schizophrenia. Notice how schizophrenics struggle to maintain a fixed identity? This is because they have no monologue reinforcing their ego. There are obviously more reasons but that is a big reason for developing schizophrenia imo.

Neither way of thinking is more correct, and an ego is not necessarily a bad thing, without ego we would have no reason to eat or piss or do anything necessary for basic survival. That said, people should be able to just switch between either mode of thinking. I am always surprised when people present this as a binary option. If you cannot think in either mode at will, it is probably because you have reinforced one way at the expense of the other. This can be fixed by just practicing visualization or subvocalization, depending on which one you lack. It has nothing to do with someone lacking a soul or being born an NPC. Most people become confuse their inner monologue with their soul/spirit because our culture reinforces types of thinking that promote narcissism and reward egoic behavior.

You really shouldn't call anyone an NPC or imply someone lacks a soul. You could send someone into a seriously bad thought spiral and confuse the people with REAL souls who have simply been spiritually lobotomized by a culture they were born into.

>>33625477
Nice get.

>I feel everyone hates or grows tired of me
I felt that way, too. Then I realized a lot of it was in my head, internalized from going though hell when I was younger. The rest was the fact I was surrounded by shallow gits. Shallow people and deeper people naturally do not get along in the long term.

The first step was teaching myself that people don't hate me, especially if they hardly know me. They actually are indifferent most of the time. As to the ones who "know" you and "hate" you, stop and think about how much they get right about you. If it isn't that much, then they hate their preconceived notion of you. Hating you without really knowing you marks them as shallow fools not worth your time. Forget them. Let them go be shallow elsewhere. You don't need these people in your life.

>Thank you but how am I important
Part of being loved is also loving yourself and learning where you fit in with the world. Learning to love yourself can be hard when you have not been loved very much, but it's important. In the end you are the one person who can never leave you. Because of this, you need to accept yourself, see your value and importance as a person, and eventually love yourself. Ignore any nattering thoughts that you are not worthy or lovable: those are lies. You are worthy of love and good things. You can heal and feel better. I beleive in you!

It's also easy to ignore your physical self. If you don't care for yourself, then you can't get anything done long term. Take good care of yourself. Eat well, sleep well, drink your water and exercise. Don't smoke or engage in self-destructive behaviors. You will sober up and the problem will still be there.

It's a hard road. I know. I wish I could give you a hug and some company. You are seriously cute so hey- maybe a lot more than a hug. For now, though, all I can give is what I have learned over time. I hope it helps you find your way.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.sub: The Cult of Creativity and The Creative Singularity
posts.com:
Once upon a time a group of artists, musicians, poets, writers, scientists, philosophers, historians, theologians, engineers, and many others came together from a shared love of learning. They cross-pollinated each other's ideas and experiences with novel insights, helping each other to explore connections between fields they didn't consider before. The more they shared, the more interconnected they found themselves to be. They began to look at what they were doing, and found that their root commonality was creativity. And so they began to worship creativity itself, considering creativity as the most important thing in the world.

The Cult of Creativity spread the message of creativity by organizing public lectures and talks, workshops, star parties, funded libraries, and inspirational messages about the power of creativity. The cult grew and grew, and was welcomed by many as a learning movement.

The cult also investigated the nature of creativity itself. They gathered writings about the nature of creativity through history, and formed novel hypotheses about it. Eventually they discovered something remarkable: A Unified Theory of Creativity that described how natural, biological, and human creativity are connected. They resolved a god-like object, the Ultimate Community, which described the universe as a grand adventure between creative events through all of space and time. Creativity had become omnipresent, a principle of existence itself. With humans, creativity had created co-creators, human creative experience was an extension of the Eros of the universe itself.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The Unified Theory of Creativity had the effect of making followers of the Cult of Creativity even more devout and motivated to spread the message of creativity. The theory also led to the development of novel methods to help people cultivate their creativity both individually and socially. One member of the Cult of Creativity introduced an idea of a creative singularity, where the collective creativity of humanity would reach critical mass and become explosive, radically changing the way people thought and interacted with the world around them.

Now on a mission to change the entire world with the power of creativity, the cult worked harder than ever. They rapidly gained new members as word spread about how the message of creativity elevated people's lives and appreciation for life. They applied their creative experience to encourage cooperative problem-solving in politics and social disagreements, tackling the most difficult problems of their time. As the power of creativity grew, it became easier and easier to advance cooperation and empathy. The Cult of Creativity was on its way to becoming a global culture.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Then one day a tipping point was reached, striking almost like a bolt of lightning. Nourished by creativity, the power of human goodness was now more powerful than the power of what is essentially socially transmitted bad habits, healing those bad habits on a globally massive scale. The most broken and unfortunate members of global society were lifted up, and found new lives with others. The problem of human conflict had been solved with the emergence of a massive web of mutually reinforcing non-zero-sum relationships that embraced the entire planet. War and exploitation was over.

With their global civilization now a Utopia, the Cult of Creativity had proven the limitless power of creativity once and for all. But they didn't stop there, they looked to the stars and learned to travel to them. They found a small planet inhabited by intelligent beings, who were troubled like they used to be. They wanted to help them, but not erase their own culture, and so they worked extremely gently, discreetly sharing a small idea or inspiration here and there, that would have snowball effects, letting natural cultural evolution do the work. Eventually the alien civilization experienced its own creative singularity, and were embraced by their alien friends as equals, with their own unique culture, history, and ideas.

Moreover, every ecosystem requires a background of coexistence to thrive; the fox cannot eat a rabbit without a world that contains rabbits with it. If foxes eat all of their sources of food, they would go extinct.

Therefore making competition as the top-level strategy of human organization is an affront to human nature, and nature itself. This can be seen in what capitalism is doing: trashing the planet, because it is ultimately unsustainable. How did this situation emerge? From various sick human beings who are as addicted to money and power as the greatest drug addict, who exploit divisions between people and human weaknesses to elevate themselves. It is not human nature to endlessly hoard, that's a sickness.

>how as humans will we ever overcome our reptilian programming for competition?

By us helping to show each other who we truly are. The way to do this is to share profoundly creative experiences that nourish each others souls, imaginations, dreams, bodies and minds. With the internet we are able to do this on an unprecedented scale, many are already doing it - it's just a matter of highlighting and contextualizing what is already going on so as to encourage this to grow into a full-fledged social movement. The goal is to make conflict and mindless consumption absolutely painfully boring compared to the vibrancy of collaborative opportunities around.

>>33618209
To add on a little bit: A child is infinitely creative. As we grow older we learn the 'rules' of the real world and subconsciously apply them to our creativity, which constrains it. For example a child can think of the wildest random shit that doesn't make any sense and doesn't follow real world situations or intuitions, but it's much harder as an adult. This isn't particularly a bad thing, since applying rules to creativity allows us to try and predict the future and apply creativity in a pragmatic sense. However, we must learn to turn off those rules or selectively only apply the ones that are useful. Einstein was a pro at doing this with his thought experiments, he was able to concretely apply equations in his mind's eye and focus only on them without any other conceptions.

>How do I use this to be more creative? Like an example or
As of yet the Religion of Creativity is only a dream. However I can give insight into the fundamental process of human creativity.
Human consciousness is an evolutionary process where question, choice, and action correspond to mutation, selection, and reproduction in biological evolution. A question is a request for information, our entire sense-experience is the result of a request for information by our nervous system, and constantly mutates our consciousness. We can also actively mutate our consciousness by asking questions of our experiences, actions, choices, and ideas, and follow the resulting lines of inquiry to apprehend new possibilities previously beyond our immediate reach. From there, the selective mechanism of choice eliminates possibilities until one option is chosen to be expressed as an action.

There are two unhealthy versions of this process. In one, choice is favored at the expense of questioning, resulting in a progressive whittling-down of variation until stagnation is reached - this process is all selection with minimal mutation. Also one can start with a desired answer, and ask questions about how to confirm it - this is the method of confirmation bias. The healthy process must start by questioning experience.

The implication of this is to promote freedom, promote inquiry. Seek The Unknown, among the most profound experiences of which is wonder. The world is filled with endless opportunities for wonder, but to find them requires a conscious effort to shake-up your routines and get out of your comfort zone. Perhaps understanding the supreme importance of questioning and seeking The Unknown for your freedom could motivate you. Wonder is the carrot, the stick is the risk of being enslaved by your own stagnant thoughts and habits, or the stagnant thoughts and habits of others.

>>33618869
I think one good place to start is to reconnect with the natural world, which is the true church of creativity. The experience and appreciation of natural beauty moves the soul like nothing else.

When I was a young teenager, I looked up at the night sky and saw a blurry object that I thought could be a UFO. I looked in an amateur astronomy book my aunt had gifted me, and discovered that it was the Cassiopeia star cluster. I also read that most people with good eyesight see individual stars rather than a blur. I realized that I had poor vision informed my father, saw an optometrist, and got glasses. All of a sudden my world was in super-HD. I looked up at the night sky and saw a field of sparkling diamonds. I read the book more, began to learn the constellations, and got more interested in amateur astronomy.

I became obsessed, reading books and magazines about amateur astronomy, I got a telescope for Christmas and began to observe deep-space objects such as nebulae and galaxies. The more I learned and experienced, the greater the appreciation grew. One night I was staring up at a night sky and something like a gestalt of everything I had experienced and learned came together in a unified experience of complete and total awe that moved me to tears. It was an experience of unfathomable vastness, yet unified inter-connectivity - the universe wasn't "out there" but here.

There are many other ways to explore and appreciate natural beauty, and through it cultivate a sense of inter-connection with nature and the universe. What calls to you?

>>33613152
(1) The Earth's magnetic field is most likely generated by the interaction of flows of molten metal around the core of the planet. The flows of this metal in and out of the core, and around it (through convective processes), generates a magnetic field.

(2) The Coriolis effect and the combined magnetic and electrical generation of these processes keep the movement (very) roughly circular around the axis of rotation. If it was driven solely by convection and the Coriolis effect it would remain very stable for a long time, but the effect of powerful local magnetic fields and electric currents is able to disrupt this circular flow. If this flow is disrupted in one place, it is likely to disrupt in other places, leading to a complete destabilization of flow around the core-mantle boundary. Thus, the field collapses (no more circular flow). However, convection means the process starts up again, possibly in a different direction, possibly in the same direction.
(3) There's plenty of geological evidence to show that pole reversals can occur very quickly, and that on average they take 100-150 years to complete. The decay of our magnetic field began somewhere around 1900, and is accelerating.

As the field decays there will be several noticeable effects. First, it takes a weaker and weaker flare to produce a Carrington type event due to weaker shielding. Second, this weaker shielding results in more high energy particle bombardment in the upper atmosphere (the primary driver of short and long term changes in global climate [notably, most mass extinction events are associated with pole reversals]).

(4) How does electricity work? Not by the flow of electrons per se, but by the interaction of magnetic fields generated by the flow of electrons. The magnetic field of the sun interacts with planetary magnetic fields in the solar system to form an electric circuit. But in terms of this discussion, that interaction doesn't matter so much.

What has been put forwards is that the sun can, and will, undergo a micronova event. We are currently passing through the galactic midplane (an electromagnetic plane created by the supermassive star/black hole cluster at the center of the galaxy) which carries a substantial load of interstellar dust. This dust is not conjecture, it is here, and astronomists have been reporting it for about a year now.

The sun is essentially a large nuclear fire. What happens what you throw a bunch of very cold, flammable dust on a fire? I've had bonfires at -40, and I'll tell you: first the fire dampens, then the fire gets much bigger than before and very quickly. The same would occur if you were to bombard the sun with a high amount of cosmic dust - the outer shell would cool, the sun would dim, and then the built up energy in the interior would catch up, the shell would warm up enough, and a "small" explosion would occur in which the outer shell of the sun is cast off.

There are two things to note here:
First, we have observed that the two nearest stellar neighbors to pass through the midplane ahead of us flared. They didn't flare bright enough to call it a super nova, but they flared too much to write it off as a random event or error. They flared in sequence, relative to the time they entered the galactic midplane.

Second: If the outer shell of the sun were to cool, the sun would dim. It may dim so much that the sun itself would turn dark red, possibly even black, dark enough that you could look directly at the sun. Instead of the normal luminescent star you would see a dark circle halo'd by the dust particles and field interaction lines created by the powerful electromagnetic interactions of the sun.

In short, the Black Sun is most likely an ancient symbol from the last time this happened.

Something on this scale can never be answered to a satisfying depth, nor to a state in which the idea could flourish in that way where it inspires you to ask why this little subsection of it works that way, with just one answer. However I wager a larger reason is that it's just time.

Humans as a species have always ruled themselves and their communities to the best of their ability. Individually through seeking to best the trials they face through necessity or an eager passion with fingers in every feasible category if not idea. Communally through the needs to sustain and grow to the established extent and further, refining, shifting, splitting, and so on. No different than building a rough scaffolding only for the installation of a sturdier framework with it.

It is only in recent generations that the depth of debauchery and for lack of a better term unusualness has risen to the heights seen. You, anon, have seen this more than others enough to come here, be brought here by that innate urge for mastering ones self I briefly touched above. The pendulum swings as it has always in history. If it swings this far in one direction, and the world is in a negative state, then imagine when it swings back. Is this not the scaffolding for a sturdier framework? We are not the only world, just this is our current one. Could an idea not be posed that what we deal with here proves what we're capable of and thus worthy of elsewhere having earned our gift? Note this is not to inspire passiveness or defeatism, nor suggest it, but to acknowledge that no matter how pushed we are to pursue self mastery in these current straits to rise above or better prepare for the idea of something worse that we are still in some form of community and that its fair to live as if your effort here reaps fair reward.

I am not at my best with words at this hour, if there is interest in discussion I will be back later.

Forgive me for having to remember that I love you.

I'm not a doctor and i'm not trained in biology, so my opinion on this doesn't come from any expertise, but as an independent thinker I've critically analysed the claims for and against viruses, especially and specifically covid, and I've come to the position that viruses simply don't exist, or that there certainly isn't good strong evidence to believe in them in most cases. This is obviously a position that sounds insane at first, as it sounded to me only two years ago, but that's the position I've come to, and I think anyone who actually looks into this and is capable of questioning things can see the same.

You claim you had multiple shifting symptoms for example. Well the official position on covid is that it can seemingly cause practically any condition - but most generally it was thought to be defined by flu-like symptoms, literally all the symptoms point by point that you get with flu. In Wuhan the original panic started because they claimed there was "atypical pneumonia", pneumonia being often a flu symptom or associated with flu... but since the original outbreak, the wider epidemiology shifted the definition so that there isn't really anything 'atypical' about the pneumonia of those who experience covid.

You didn't catch a virus because viruses don't exist and aren't contagious. Now what actually causes your illness I don't know. In my own case I had a 'flu' in Feb of 2020, and then the next illness I had was a short flu in 2022, with my new perspective I came to the conclusion that the probably triggering factor was a sudden drop in temperature (literally the entire state ran out of tissues over this week) during an antarctic blast (Australia), and the fact that i'd experienced sleeping under a 'drafty' window. This is just speculation though, I don't definitively know what actually causes 'flu' now that I don't believe in viruses.

I didn't think of this at the time because I jumped immediately to the conclusion that I had a "virus" (though I don't read the news, so didn't think of covid at the time). I think this is another case of selective perception, selective memory, and the bias of interpretation excluding possibly REAL causes of illness. The protocol is designed so that these substances don't "chip away" at your health but improve it, and it's also the reason why the protocol itself follows the recommended dosage on the package of the supplements for long term because that is the amount that is safe to use if you have no underlying medical conditions. Mixing them doesn't make it more toxic and is still safe based on what the lethal dosage suggests for each. If you get severe die-off symptoms, then you should reduce the dosage of NAC and Oregano oil and take molybdenum. Start taking full doses again once recovered.

For context, die-off symptoms occur when the biofilm breaks down and exposes the pathogenic fungi. Doing that can cause an immune response, which is what causes the die off symptoms. The goal is to remove the fungi at a slow enough pace where the die-off symptoms are minor and you can, for example, still go to work without any major issues.

It's also to note that the protocol may not be safe for some people, and you should do your own research and talk to your doctor about using the supplements. Combining a bleeding disorder, high blood pressure, very low blood pressure, or diabetes with the protocol without consulting a doctor first for example would be unwise.

Feel free to post valid criticisms or concerns, any legitimate and backed up criticism is appreciated.

Galantamine is not only an effective brain enhancer, but also has the ability to shut down inflammation systemically, directly from the brain. It prevents constant acetylcholine recycling in the brain, which appears to be a dysfunction caused by the fungus.

>Stimulation of the vagus nerve suppresses cytokine production and macrophage activation,viathe interaction of its neurotransmitter acetylcholine (ACh) with the α7 subunit of the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor (α7nAChR), present on neurons and inflammatory cells. >Galantamine, in a dose-dependent manner, reduced significantly all biomarkers of inflammation, with the highest dose showing the best beneficial anti-inflammatory effect that was superior in magnitude to the reference drug leflunomide

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S0014299915301643

So it would a unique way to treat various forms of arthritis but also autoimmune disorders. Leflunomide is a pretty hard-core anti inflammatory that can cause liver damage or failure, so galantamine would be a great alternative.

I've been on the protocol for nearly 3 months now. I have had a day or two in that whole time where I felt I had a lot of energy. But overall I've been low level sick the entire time but with new sets of symptoms rising as others fall.

Positives:
- I always had diarrhea and irritable bowels before in the past. That has gone. I haven't had any issues with that since I started.
- Although I've been too sick/tired to meditate lately. The few times I have have been amazing.
- Dreaming has gotten more lucid. I feel I have more control over my dreams. Can almost decide what to dream now.

Negatives:
- Constantly: lethargic and tired. Carb and sugar cravings. Weight gain.
- Mostly: Extremely irritable and angry. Feels almost like a constant but low-level niacin flush. More violent/intrusive thoughts than usual. Peaking in late afternoon/early evening.
- Sporadic: Insomnia. That sort of went away. But it comes and goes now.
- I got soars/dead skin on my hands for a few weeks. I also looked grey for a while. That seems to have gone away.
- same time, I had tension headaches (back of my head) for about two weeks. Most intense headaches of my life. They went away. They were thunderclap headaches that just hit me and stayed for like 3 days. I never had those before.
- Now I'm having serious heartburn/indigestion even when I don't eat anything at all. Spewing up green phlegm (even when having not eaten in 8+ hours).

I'm not sure when this ends. But I hope soon. This really sucks. There's enough positive to keep me motivated to stay on the protocol. But there sure is a lot of unpleasantness.

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

Had an insane lucid dream. Like most of them sex was in it but scattered between everything for some reason. I was actually able to consciously speak to my own mind. I'm assuming that's what dreams are made of, since a single thought and the entire landscape changes.

posts.com:
Lately my attitude towards everything has been vastly improved, by choice. I'm saying positive affirmations a lot, am doing yoga, eating well, and generally have a more empowered feeling. This has been reflected in my dreams! I have more awareness in general, and more control once I become lucid.
The other night set the bar higher for me. I woke up about half an hour before my alarm, and decided to have a good dream for the remaining time. I lay in bed thinking about all the people I'm thankful to have in my life, and then proceeded to dream for what felt like an entire day, about going to a "waterpark" with my fiancée. It was sort of like the poolrooms, only outside, in the sun. Occasionally, I would get the typical worries I get while on vacation - is the dog being taken care of well, etc. But then I would remind myself it was just a dream. Literally the best dream I've ever had.
I've changed my tactic basically. Rather than becoming lucid and trying to teleport to where I want to be, I set positive intentions while awake and then go lucid in whatever place I end up. Guides in this general have helped a lot!
Last night I was exploring with some old classmates and current coworkers. One said something about the "other kids" getting candy. So I decided to find it, and voila, found the stairs leading up to the "candy room". I ate sour patch kids and M&Ms. The colors were so vivid and the sugar rush felt real. I think I'm in a childlike place mentally/spiritually.

Had a very short lucid dream last night. I'm a pretty regular lucid dreamer but it's still great to get them.
>reading sheet music in my loungeroom in preparation for a rehearsal
>the piece is real, "Ride" by Sam Hazo ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=au4geHy_S_0 ), but it doesn't look like how it should
>everything's properly legible but it doesn't fit with the piece as I know it
>look up
>a woman I don't really recognise is sitting at the table
>look at the far wall
>there's a bird cage on a pedestal and one of my pet cockatiels sitting on top of the cage
>waitaminute, my last cockatiel died years ago and I got rid of that cage when I decided no more birds
>I'M DREAMING
>there's a decent amount of resistance in the dream to me becoming lucid
>at first there's a small amount of doubt because of how real and normal everything feels, then things shift a little bit and I know that I was correct
>the light coming in the windows disappears like it suddenly became late evening outside
>the woman disappears
>get up and leave the house through the front door
>yep, it's pretty dark, feeling a bit uneasy
>a small insect buzzes my ear, looked like a fly
>grab it and it stays still
>90% sure something bad's going to happen despite my lucidity, which usually means something bad will happen
>reach the street and look down it
>there's a cluster of beautiful blue lights in the road a little bit further down the street
>as I get closer they start to form an emblem, which I was absolutely gobsmacked by its beauty
>took a good look at it so I could attempt to replicate it, but my skills aren't good enough in waking life to do it anywhere near the justice it deserves
>attempt to take a steam screenshot of it, even hear the click and even see the screenshot taken panel in my vision
>think to myself "There's no way that's going to persist after I wake up. A screenshot from a dream would be worldshattering"
>leave the dream an unusual way, feels like I'm being pulled upwards to my bed

for the ultra clear one? I became lucid in the dream, it was accidental
but I remember that I was sleeping disastrously all the previous days, only naps like that day(literally) and at that moment I think I had an alarm activated because I wanted to get up later to eat something... so i guess it was a bit of WBTB too

now i only have lucid dreams when i am a bit sleepy (not too much) i lie on my back and do breathing exercises focusing on it while i am listening to something on youtube at a very low volume
once I think I didn't even do breathing exercises and I only paid attention (a bit) to the audios I put on but I refused to sleep
other times I didn't pay attention to the audio (but still audio playing) but I did pay attention to what I saw in the dark
and other times the same but while I tried to move my "ghost" body (breathing exercises, you feel sleepy but then you start trying to move your body without moving a single muscle, as if you were preparing to move but you don't)... I think this was the most useful for me, now that I remember. I think I'm going to try again right now, I haven't done it in a long time.
the trick is to remain conscious but RELAXED to tell your brain or body that you are already sleeping while your consciousness is still active
Whatever you choose to do, it's extremely important that you do not move a single physical muscle or open your eyes, that's what all my successful attempts agree on

There are quite a large number of Petroglphs discovered in South Western India which they say are evidence of a lost 12,000 year old civilization as in The Konkan Petroglyphs, the claim is somewhat problematic as there's no evidence of any civilization discovered in conjunction with the carvings and the dating is reliant on stone tools found in a nearby cave which they've sort of dated to that period, but anyway the petroglyphs are splendid and one of the common motifs seen is considered to represent Aquarius as the Water bearer.

https://kevinstandagephotography.wordpress.com/2019/03/14/the-konkan-petroglyphs-barsu-sada/

If the dating and identification is correct then that would represent Aquarius at the time it was at the Autumn Equinox, were it has presently become were the Spring Equinox rises. It's also noteworthy that the motif is seen in conjunction with a pair of Tigers, if these are taken to represent Leo then that is opposite to Aquarius in the Zodiac and thus when Southern Aquarius rose at the Autumn Equinox then Northern Leo rose at the Spring Equinox.

in basic terms the logic of this could be two seemingly opposites united as a singular concept, it's also the case that the connective morpheme sign used can be considered a derivative of the water-bearer symbol itself, which carries two loads balanced in opposition, thus the sign is sometimes considered to relate to balance and judgement.
