Might need some help understanding this one (or I guess, these ones).

To put it simply, the dream started with me hanging out on the corner of a street in a small alley with one streetlight emitting a yellow shine on the sidewalk and street in front of me. From what I can remember, a black car like an SUV or van pulled up near me, the window rolled down, and I saw the face of a goth-looking chick in the passenger seat and a good friend of mine driving. He said that he wanted to know if I was down to drive to the local Wal-Mart with him, to which I complied and hopped in the backseat. (From what was implied, I think the goth chick was just his other friend and they weren’t a couple or anything.)

So, we drove down to Wal-Mart, and entered it at what felt like around 9 to 10 pm at night. Inside was the usual appearance of a large Wal-Mart store, but to our right as we entered was this strange museum exhibit. It had a bunch of strange fossils and old tools in display cases that lined the area it was in in a sort of “U” shape. We looked at the fossils, and then the goth chick told me to follow her while my buddy was still observing the fossils. I, again, complied and followed her, where we entered a laundry sort of room, with a couple of washing machines and baskets of clothing or white towels and sheets.

After we both entered, she started speaking to me of how much she was solely “interested” in me. I only remember that she said that word rather than any other. It wasn’t truly in a romantic context, but it did seem like she was trying to say that she wanted to know me better, or something along those lines. I don’t remember much of our conversation after that, but she did then ask if I could help her wash the clothes that were in the room, to which I accepted and shoved the clothes into the washers.
(Continued in my next reply.)

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33612117

After we were out of the laundry room, my friend came along and we followed him back to the car, as he had done his shopping while we “did the laundry.” (I don’t know why this Wal-Mart had a laundry room.)

We got back in the car, but now another friend of my buddy was driving. He was this Albanian guy with short hair wearing a leather jacket and some jeans, and a pair of glasses (kind of looked like Elliot Rodger but also like an Albanian badass biker.) He spoke in an accent and took us all to his house. The house was a one-room home. There was a living room, a little corner of the home for a kitchen, a mini fridge next to the couch of the living room, and a big bed in the corner. It was dimly lit by a lamp that gave off a similar shine to the street lamp from the start of the dream. There was also a large Albanian flag behind the couch on the wall, and in front of the couch was a TV playing old SpongeBob episodes.

He invited us inside, although my friend said he had to go home for the night, so he filled the mini fridge with the groceries he bought and drove off. The Albanian dude asked if me and the goth chick wanted to stay for the night. Out of a sense of curiosity and the feeling of coziness the home was filled with, we accepted and settle down on the couch to watch SpongeBob.

The Albanian prepared us a nice plate of cheese, crackers, and grapes, and then sat on his bed and started reading a Bible sat on his bedside table. Meanwhile, the Goth chick started getting closer to me and soon enough, put her arm around me.

All I can remember after that was that me and the girl I think fell asleep on the couch, and the Albanian probably soon after fell asleep in his bed.

I’ve had this in my dream journal and in my memories for a long while. What did this mean, if anything? Thanks, OP.

Male, Europe, had dream around 19.

Most happy : not a lot. I have food and shelter, I suppose.

Least happy : NEET at the time, no sentimental life, everything I want to do or have is basically outside my reach. General loneliness even if I'm around people.

I was living with my mom. I dreamed that one day, I woke up, and my mom had adopted an harpy. Not a mythological harpy, a cute, anime-esque one, basically a girl with wings instead of arms and talons instead of feet.

I was confused at having someone else I don't know living in my house and honestly pissed at it since I like being left alone, but over what felt a couple months, I warmed up to her and started treating her like a little sister. Nothing lewd, romantic, or whatever, just a will to protect and care for her.

I was bringing her at high school (she wasn't a student, I just had to keep an eye on her at all times), which I was at the time starting to drop from, and slowly started getting better since I felt less lonely with her by my side and her asking about classes even if she didn't understand made it easier to learn my lessons. I was starting to get friends, and I was starting to get out of the depression I was in at the time of my dream IRL.

This lasted a couple months. My dream felt around two years long. She was with me all the way, through thick and thin, I often had to help her with everyday stuff since she had no hands to speak of, just a couple claws, sometimes we bickered, but I was happy to just have her around.

The last thing I clearly remember is the dream's end. I was sitting with her on a step in the garden.

We were just eating popsicles, enjoying a summer evening, and she was telling me something. I don't remember what, just that she was happy and thrilled about it.

The last thing I remember seeing before waking up was the sunset behind her and her smile. A genuine, warm smile. Of someone innocent that was enjoying living.

Then I woke up and had to go to class.
I still miss her.

Then I looked around but there was no one else and there were nothing but white buildings on both sides. I'm not sure which country's architectural style these buildings were in but they were all white and in different shapes and sizes. I turned around and saw that I had climbed pretty far up the stairs, and in the far distance (probably at the bottom of the stairs) there was a scenic view of a beach with a beautiful ocean and a clear blue sky.
But then a gust of wind picked up making me turn my face away, only to see a girl a bit farther up the stairs than me. She was around my age (when I had the dream) wore a delicate clean white dress that fluttered in the wind and had a white sun hat with a wide brim that hid her bright blond hair. I don't remember what she looked like, not even her skin color, but I think she was beautiful.
She was standing there looking out into the distance, then she turned her head and looked at me. And that's where the dream ended, I think. Or that's as much as I can remember.

Two things:
>From your early teens to your mid-twenties, there's a tendency to have very sexual dreams, which have little meaning beyond your raging hormones pushing you to get off in your sleep. Sometimes these manifest as wet dreams, but more often do not.
>Outside of those types of dreams, symbology from the subconscious is usually indirect. For example, if you're feeling pressure to get some project done, you almost never dream about the actual project. Instead, you might dream about being chased by a bear.
The point is, don't take incest dreams at face value - unless you entertain these fantasies in real life, they don't mean you secretly want to have sex with your female relatives.

>>33618632

Exaltation is a place where a point expresses itself in its purest most unhindered form.

The Nodes are the points in which the Moon's orbital path intersects with the ecliptic (The Earth's orbital path around the Sun). The North Node is where the Moon goes from below the ecliptical plane to above it, while the South Node is where it goes from above that plane to below it.

The North Node is the point where the native would see the most growth in, but growing of course takes effort and hardship. The South Node is the point where the native won't really see any more growth in, as they basically have it down.

Gemini is Hot, Moist, and Mutable. Gemini is assertive, receptive, and yet willing to yield to other forces. Gemini then is a sign that is focused on sharing and exchanging with others, whatever those others are. The North Node here would show that one's growth is best done through such activities as sharing and exchanging, and through that a strong network can eventually be established.

Sagittarius is Hot, Dry, and Mutable. Sagittarius is assertive, independent, and yet willing to give way. With the South Node here, it would show how easy it is for one to have a level of conviction, and so developing that conviction to do what you have to do comes like the back of one's hand. A solid foundation if you will towards going towards other pursuits.

The Depression is the inverse of all of that, where one finds it easy to have their sharing and exchanging networks only to have to grow the best by becoming independent from that, potentially losing all of that in the process.

You just get the most out of the North Node in Gemini and the South Node in Sagittarius.

Granted, the Nodes aren't points of light, so what I said here won't fly with a lot of Astrologers.

>>33624942
My view on this kind of stuff is that unless you are indian and literally from that country learning a bunch of obscure terms that have nothing to do with your daily life isn't going to help you be more well adjusted. Actually being involved in a religion on purpose without being indoctrinated into that religion from childhood is probably going to make you awkward and full of half realized knowledge.

Yoga is basically just about exploration of the self as an integral part of the Godhead, so I think ideas about yoga are really helpful, and maybe some yoga practice is helpful, but don't go full balls to the wall Hindu unless you were born there or you will end up being a dissatisfied idiot.

You should read it and cherry pick interesting ideas to transform your own thinking just like any other book, but try to keep in mind the broader context. Sometimes cherrypicking results in lopsided wisdom.

I saw Nexpo at a grocery store in Los Angeles yesterday. I told him how cool it was to meet him in person, but I didn’t want to be a douche and bother him and ask him for photos or anything. He said, “Oh, like you’re doing now?” I was taken aback, and all I could say was “Huh?” but he kept cutting me off and going “huh? huh? huh?” and closing his hand shut in front of my face. I walked away and continued with my shopping, and I heard him chuckle as I walked off. When I came to pay for my stuff up front I saw him trying to walk out the doors with like fifteen Milky Ways in his hands without paying.

The girl at the counter was very nice about it and professional, and was like “Sir, you need to pay for those first.” At first he kept pretending to be tired and not hear her, but eventually turned back around and brought them to the counter.

When she took one of the bars and started scanning it multiple times, he stopped her and told her to scan them each individually “to prevent any electrical infetterence,” and then turned around and winked at me. I don’t even think that’s a word. After she scanned each bar and put them in a bag and started to say the price, he kept interrupting her by yawning really loudly.

>>33624488
Basically the same as you would any other god/ess. Learn as much about them as you can. Then, think about what they stand for. What are their lessons? How do they behave? Do they say how you should behave? If not, then looking at what you know, how do you think they want you to behave? Now, apply that to your everyday life.

Be sure to give thanks for any blessings you receive. Making a small altar can help in this as it gives you a place to pray and leave offerings. Choose items They like and use that as inspiration.

>Examples of this stuff using Aphrodite
Do your own work. here. Don't just use my ideas. The personal nature of your effort is a form of worship, too, and will mean more than just doing stuff I suggest.

Aphrodite is a goddess of love, both erotic and not. One of her alternate names roughly means "She who loves smiles". Consider the nature of love and it's place in your life. Who do you love? Love yourself, others and the world as best as you can. Share a smile. Bring joy. Also learn from her mistakes. If you have/get someone who loves you, treat them right.

The altar should be made of Applewood or Myrtle if possible. A box turned upsideown works fine. Lovingly carve or paint her favorite things on it such as roses and doves. Adorn it with pearls and mirrors. Offer sweet treats like you would a lover. Candied roses, heart shaped chocolates, seashell chocolates, rose scented candles, ect.

I hope this is a good starting point!

posts.com:
I think the real issue is that people have gotten lazy in terms of internet use and creating OC online - most of the OC generation going on today seems to be on twitter, tiktok, instagram etc and it's always OC created within certain political and normality limits. The "free internet" sites like 4chan have essentially ossified and died. 4chan's users are now mostly just passing posters, with very little real investment in creating or maintaining any sort of board or site-wide culture, and 4chan is colonised by the OC creation and culture of twitter, and also discord (in a sense this was 'reverse colonisation', as discord itself appropriated everything from 4chan, then the backwash ruined 4chan).

Internet cultures\communities have risen and fallen at a rapid pace since the mid 90's. I used a regular on IRC from about 1996 to 2014 or so, and in that time I saw lots of cultures thrive and fall, different servers, different channels, different people with different values coming together in different ways, all of this involves constant 'death' and abandonment of previous cultures\communities. Also over time the cultures\communities often become solidified, so you have some "terminally online" people who tend to set themselves up as OPS or channel owners on IRC to maintain a position of social status, and get stuck there, same thing happens on discord I guess. So you actually have lots of communities that slow down to a snails pace where various individuals get 'stuck' or become 'comfortable' there, and then these people are essentially isolated from taking part in and creating OC in other online spaces.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33618137

Another factor I've observed is that porn use and posting ruined a lot of cultures on many levels. Therapy sites I once went to used to be filled with interesting fun young people trying to help others, now they're dominated by catfish narcissists (often trannies for some reason) and 'sex chatters' who completely disrupt anyone trying to use the sites for their actual intended purposes. On 4chan, porn posting ruined the NSFW boards for me, and I know it ruined them for others. The universality of porn also means you have far more people who are constantly running on low dopamine, so they have shorter attention spans, in many cases are probably posting with one hand while fapping furiously to porn with another, etc.

Commercialisation is another factor. I mentioned discord's cultural appropriation in my previous post - well pretty much all of 4chan type culture was appropriated and mainstreamised first by sides like Encyclopedia Dramatica, but later on tens of authors have written books, there have been movies (at least two movies about r9k culture specifically), and 4chan has been mentioned on mainstream movies and TV thousands of times, latest one I saw was the most recent 'Scream' movie. All of this empties out the culture, and also creates a situation where most people are aware that anything they create will be appropriated by others, sometimes for nefarious purposes, it stifles discussion.

The internet has also become increasingly legislated and policed, which means it's more and more dangerous to express your opinion online, and we're all aware on some level that anything we post could be used against us in some way by spooks or others.

Just a bunch of factors that come to mind that can give this impression of the internet being 'dead'.

posts.com:
Does anyone else on here not fully trust the cosmic death fungus generals constantly posted on /x/? It seems whoever’s posting them sees fungi as their enemy, and their agenda seems to be the complete separation of man and fungi. But let’s review some basic points:
>Fungi are an integral part of nature, vital for nutrient recycling within the soil. They are the bridge between death and new life in many ecosystems.
>Many fungi are at the root of ancient and modern medicines, used to cure everything from infections to cancer. Penicillin alone has helped save countless lives in the past century.
>Fungi are at the heart of human culture and food. The bread and wine of Jesus are yeasted foods. The holy cacao of the Mesoamericans and the coffee of the Sufis are also products that have undergone fermentation in order to fully harness their mystic properties.
>Ergot and Psilocybin mushrooms are prehistoric mind openers, which likely facilitated man’s journey towards spirituality. They enable ordinary people to briefly see as the mystics see, and have helped countless people open their eyes to the divine nature of existence.
Now I’m not saying that all fungus is good. People do die or suffer from fungal infections, and there are many mushrooms that are deadly if consumed. But we can say the same about any natural phenomena. They aren’t wholly good or evil, they are a part of nature, the same divine nature which humans sprung from, and which modernity increasingly separates us from. So I’m incredibly sceptical of anyone who insists that it is a good thing to purge this from our bodies. In recent years we have come to understand just how vital our gut bacteria is, not just for our digestion, but for our whole body and brain function as well. Perhaps one day we will find out the same thing about the fungus. In the end, there is only unity.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33625000
Image streaming seems like the right approach to training the minds eye. The key is concepts become anchors to sensory details. Image streaming is activating a lot of senses while rushing to fit it into rough descriptive concepts. It's very jank but that's probably the point. When I tell you to imagine lots of grass the idea itself can invoke a whole scene with sunlight on an open field with shadows from clouds, distant mountains, dew and bugs in the air, and maybe a few animals in the distance and the feeling of wind cooling you off. Etc. But all you thought was "lots of grass". I think this connection is what image streaming is about and why it works surprisingly well.

I don't think you need a photographic memory but rather enough of an imagination that any blanks are filled in very clearly. It might be better to focus on polishing one scene or object until it's detail is second nature. Then with that neural pathway built the rest of your brain has a natural path towards clearer visuals.

I think with detailed clarity and constant focus the minds eye will slowly but surely become more vivid. I don't have a super vivid imagination myself. it will probably take stupid amounts of effort and consistency because adult brains don't like to change. If you drop it it might undo progress. I'm sure if you spend 8 hours a day in your thoughts every single day your imagination will become extremely vivid after like half a year or so. Theoretically after 3 months of something your brain adapts a routine and for a lot of people with extremely vivid imaginations, using it constantly seems to be the daily habit.

Also, an interesting tidbit, if you look at any brain charts the limbic system seems like the most direct neural path from the prefrontal cortex to the visual cortex and other areas. I've heard that emotional suppressants can completely kill imagination and LoA stuff says emotion is key. Just speculation though.

posts.name: chase
posts.com:
>>33607261
Well i find that very interesting and i happen to have one i captured as a adolescent years ago. this one is very red compared to the adults, it was trapped in the leg of a lander i made in the begining, the college wanted the specimen and later cut off all contact with me when college students came after me ( because their department spent millions on a ROV that failed 500ft down )

Here is the pic and this is all i know of them

They get larger the deeper you find them, the size of a ant at 400ft, about 4-5 inches or more as an adult at the bottom, as they age they become more transparent. They are extreamly focused at the fault line, at the fault line i have some video showing potentially shimmery water ( possibly chemical or temperature differential ) they run and jump down the fault line. I have a theory ( because of their massive populations ) that is they are native they might have a possible positive impact on the classic clarity of Tahoes blue waters.

pic is taken with a macro lense specimen is about 2cm in length, found at 1630-1650ft

>>33610016

OKay lol heres the story

I was 21, in the military and doing college part time. I wanted to see the bottom of Lake Tahoe but there were not pictures or videos to be found so i simply designed some stuff to achieve that goal and nailed it my first try.

What i didnt know is at least two colleges were racing to be the first to see the bottom of tahoe... also what i did not know at the time was they went to launch their multimillion dollar ROV and after 500ft they broke a fibre optics line, lost telemetry, and almost lost the whole thing from what ive heard. i know there were 30 people working on that and most were PHD.

Then what i also did not know is that they were doing this to get funding from NASA or work with NASA or somthing . i believe it was to explore a under ice lake that they were drilling through to ice blahblah..

Anyways im kinda not well with gauging peoples emotions and whatnot so when i first seen the bottom of lake tahoe it was enar thanksgiving so i sent them a postcard that read " Happy thanksgiving from the bottom of lake tahoe"....

posts.name: chase
posts.com:
>>33610016
I did this with no ill intent, i really expected them to reply" WOW great job congrats, we would love to use your findings"

but i guess i took away the title they wanted to be the first to the bottom of lake tahoe... at the same time i discovered the shrimp down there and the fault line

I was pretty bummed they did not think it was cool

Then i had students emailing me some rude stuff... then they got into my cloud storage somehow and posted my designs on the internet... but this did not bother me, i told them thank you and i would love to share my designs with the world so the rest of us normal people could explore tahoe..
then the news story happened on KCRA 3... the news mentioned that the college failed and confirmed with historians and experts that i was the first and dubbed me with the title...

That made the colleges more mad...
They gave up from what i understand

Then i got in contact with Christopher McKay who was in charge of NASAs anoulog research department he invted me to Palo Alto and told me they could use me in their analog research department... i said no thank you because it would involve me moving to SanFran and i really cant do crowded places.. i like the woods i live in.

Still talk to Chris though, really nice guy.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
It really depends on who you are.

Some people are born or raised in such a way that they have a clean mind and few psychological problems. For them it's easy to focus and direct their mind.

Others (like how I used to be) literally live in their mind all day long, they daydream a lot and their thoughts literally control their actions and how they feel, and the worst is that they don't even realize it because they've been living like this for so long.

So I'd suggest that you just sit and observe, just sit and don't chase anything because you may be just chasing goals which are not achievable or you might be running away from harsh truths which you must first face and endure before you can move on to greater things.

Your mind is NOT you, this was a hard pill for me to take, all those thoughts which sound 100% true are just fabrications of a wild mind.

So yeah, just sit and watch, watch how your mind goes running around but don't follow it, nor make stories about it, don't try anything for there is nothing to try, just sit, your mind will come up with all crazy stuff and you will just sit there and watch it BUT without thinking "Oh I'm watching now, I'm meditating so good" for that is also thinking.

Just be the observer, and yes, with time your mind will calm down and you will be left alone or with very few thoughts, then the real "You" will start becoming clearer and that's when you can direct your focus on APing, chakras/whatever, subconscious, old forgotten memories and other things.
But you gotta first sit in silence, sit without trying to do anything. Just observe.

Taken from the link: 1/2

Back in the day, when I was in college, me and the oldest took off to a lake in the wilds of glacier country. I have extensive backcountry exposure, even did a stint as a big game guide in a remote backcountry camp. On this day we enjoyed the fishing and settled in for the night.

I pulled out my pan and stoked up a nice fire. It was clear and cool as the sun faded into the western slopes. We cooked up some fresh rainbows with garlic and butter and filled our stomachs. I leaned back against the cooler after pulling out a refreshing beverage. The boy was soon asleep by the fire as it had been a busy day. I sipped my beer and watched the moon light bouncing off the little waves in the lake. There was still a light glow on the western horizon where the sun had gone down and I could see the outline of the mountain peaks towering over the little lake. I slowly faded off to sleep with the sound of the lake waves gently lapping on the rocks.

I awoke with a start. The fire was out, the lantern was out too. The moon was gone and it was pitch black. Something was wrong. The hair on the back of my neck stood straight out. I was paralyzed. I could hear my heart thumping as I strained to hear something in the bush, all was quiet. I had a horrible uneasy feeling. I gathered myself together and started kicking around the fire, a small flame came alive and I quickly threw on some wood. In the firelight I could see that the boy had awoke and was shocked to see his wide open eyes staring at me. "What's wrong?" he asked. "Nothing, go climb in the tent." I lied. He crawled into the tent but even in the light of fire I couldn't shake my wariness. Something was out there in the bush, and I could feel it was watching me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>33579750
2/2

I gathered up my light and flashed around camp. Nothing. Finally, I began to calm down and crawled in the tent with the boy. Then again, like clockwork, I awoke completely tense. This time I couldn't shake the feeling at all. I finally instructed the boy to wake up and go get in the truck. I packed up all of camp and drove around to the other side of the lake and slept with him in the truck. At dawn I got up and looked across the lake where we were camped earlier, and another uneasy feeling came over me. I decided it was time to go home. I don't know what was out there, or what was going on over there, but I know my instincts, and something was bad wrong with that place. Whatever it was, I will leave it to your imagination, it creeps me out to this day thinking about that night.

Not my story, and I'm sure I've shared it before, but it was a bit of a weird one as far as I'm concerned. Probably disappointing to anyone who reads it.

>Member of this forum back in the 2000s
>It's a music forum, but it has subforums for offtopic things like movies, sports, general chat, that kind of thing
>Another thing about it is that it was a local forum with everyone living within ~60 miles of each other so there was much, much less trickery because you didn't want a reputation for being a retard
>Sometime between 2006 and 2009
>User on there says he's just bought a webcam and it picked up something strange
>This was some years ago and it's not like the 4KUHD ones zoomers have now
>This was a piece of shit 2 frames per second kind that we had back then
>Anyway he had set his camera up to record just to test it out
>Middle of the day in one of the rooms (I think it was his bedroom)
>It didn't record like newer ones do, it was more like it took a pic every X amount of seconds or whatever
>Posts the pics up
>See him sitting at his computer
>Dad shouts of him and he goes to see what he wants
>See him leaving the room
>Camera still clicks away
>It's just his bedroom
>Then on two frames there's this really odd thing like a tattered translucent black sheet just hovering in the middle of the room
>Not on any other frames
>Just his bedroom again
>Then he comes back and sits back down at his computer
>Only finds it when he goes back through the pics and then posts them to the forum

One of the most convincing spook pics I've seen because, like I say, I knew the people on there irl and they would have no reason to try and fake spooky pics. Especially when he wasn't that type of person anyway and it wasn't that kind of forum.
Never bothered saving them because I was under the impression the forum would stay around forever. Instead it shut down a few years ago.

Guess I'll contribute
>Be me
>Decide to go solo camping in Pennsylvania Appalachians bc why the fuck not
>Middle of the summer, so pack relatively light. Just bring a light sleeping bag and a single person tent in case it rains
>Section im hiking on to get to my planned campsite isn't too bad, well marked, and even run into a few fellow hikers on the way there
>Specifically meet this cool dude training to through hike the following year, let's name him mark
>Talks about how he was hiking a stretch going from southern new York to northern Maryland, just to practice the full PA part of the trail, as it's considered some of the hardest
>Cool.jpg
>After about 20 minutes of talking, I bid him farewell, as we are hiking in opposite directions
>Get to my campsite around 7pm, around 15 miles from my starting point, where I left at 2pm
>Only person there, kinda relieved as it means I have more space to make a fire and cook dinner(mountain house beef stroganoff yum)
>Pitch up my tent, make a firepit, when suddenly I heard movement in a large raspberry bush just at the edge of the site
>Assume it's a bear, and decide to go in my tent to not bother it, as I only have a .22 on me for varmint defense
>About 10 minutes later I leave my tent, assuming the bear has left, as I no longer heard any movement in the treeline
>Surprised to see my buddy from earlier at the site, just standing at the entrance near the trail marker
>"Hey, what brings you here? I thought we were going opposite directions?"
>No reply, he just smiles at me with a huge stupid grin on his face
>Odd, I thought, as there's no way he doesn't recognize me at this distance
>About to ask him if he wants to join me for dinner, when I notice something off
>He's not wearing his backpack
>In fact, the only "gear" he has on besides clothes is his hat and boots
>Decide to ignore him for now and make my dinner
>As I eat my dinner, he finally moved and sits on a log to the opposite of the site from me, staring at the ground

I developed a weird hobby for most of the year back in 2020. I'd prowl the internet looking for ancient, decrepit forums, the kinds no one posts on anymore, the kinds long dead and forgotten ever since facebook and twitter and plebbit came into being, and i'd register a new account (if i could) and just start messaging random particularly old accounts. Usually I'd send weird images, /x/ type photos, shit like that, occasionally I'd ask weird questions, like "is anybody there?" or "what are you?" The novelty wore off quickly but I couldn't help but keep doing it, constantly I'd check my email and the inbox on whatever forum I was on to see if anyone responded, to see if I weirded some guy out, and I'd always get this little hit of adrenaline before I saw my inbox lay bare, or my most recently received email was for penis enlargement pills. That thrill of the idea of someone responding, as voyeuristic as it was, kept me going.

I had received quite a few replies surprisingly, usually people laughing me off, asking if i was a spam bot, some telling me to kill myself, etc. None really worth noting, but... In November I got quite the reply. On some old forum for (I think) some type of second life fan group, I had messaged a guy who hadn't logged in since 2006. My message was simple, in all lower case, italicized, "why are you here." Now I had picked him out in particular for no real reason other than his real name was displayed on his profile, and we shared first names. I decided, as a bit, I'd do up my profile as similar to his as possible, and even used the same name as him. I wanted to fuck with him, hoping I'd get a really funny response. I didn't.

cont.

Simply attached in the shitty SMS system on the website was a video. It was very low quality, probably compressed to even fit on the website, and it was of the outside of a suburban home, late at night. The footage was fuzzy, dim, and tinged a fluorescent orange. No lights were on in the house, and the camera seemed to be sat in some bushes. Gently, the bushes rustled as the camera was repositioned, and it was sat directly in front of the house, the door centered in the view. Slowly, the camera zoomed in on the front door, the two windows at the front barely visible in the periphery. One of the windows opened, and some guy in baggy, white clothes climbed out. I could only see his side, but he seemed to be wearing streetwear of some kind, that's the best I can describe his clothes. And slowly the camera zoomed out again, giving a wide birth of the front yard once more. Slowly 6 men walked into the yard from the left and right of the camera's view, standing together, facing the house, and clasping hands. The video had no audio, but it seemed to me like they were singing something. The house's lights turned on, suddenly, and a silhouette of a woman walked in front of one of the windows. Again the video quality was shit, but it looked like she was shocked by something, before quickly being rammed by something and falling backwards.

This was by far the weirdest fucking reply I had ever gotten in my entire escapade doing this. And it sort of broke the habit, someone topped my fucking weirdness. I tried to go back and get the video from the site before I began typing all of this up, but the fucker had been banned for "spam," and weirdly it seemed a lot of the people I had messaged before on the site itself had recently came online. A few times I was spammed with nudes or porn in response, one time gore, but I have a few other interesting things I came across in my time doing this. The story I shared was probably as interesting as it gets, though.

This one was from a Sims forum, and I think it might've been the first time I got a response. This was before I started trying to do creepy shit as a bit, and it was more like prank calls. I found the account of some modder who seemed to be popular on the forums, who vanished sometime circa 2014. I asked about a mod he made, and said that the download was broken, and started preparing my web of lies for this. I hopped off my pc to go make myself some dinner because it was getting late and I hadn't eaten much all day, and to my delight after a night's rest, I woke up to a message back. Unfortunately, it was a little sad. There was an indicator in the message that it was originally sent as email, apparently the guy who owned the account passed away from some type of cancer and that the person managing his email (who I think was his wife or perhaps a co-worker) couldn't offer any help. To date it's the only time I had something like this happen.

Another time I was actually trawling the Bay12/Dwarf Fortress forums. I'm a pretty big DF fan, probably obvious considering i'm NEET-enough to do shit like prank message people on long dead forums all day, but I messaged a guy who hadn't touched his account since 2007. He had 1 post on his account which was literally just "dwarf fortress cool." I don't know why that stuck with me all these years, I guess I found it funny. I decided to send him a stupid jumpscare video, sorta like picrel. He shot me a message back of a shotgun, a string of numbers (I'm guessing it was meant to be my IP, but I checked my IP soon after and the numbers didnt match up) and a box of shells. So I will tell you what the deal is.

By the time I am finished telling you beloved you will see why those that die and come back kiss the ground and thank God they are alive, thankful for every single moment.

1. You are God, the field of infinite possibility.

2. When you die this will happen. You will find out you are still conscious and will, separated from your body, probably floating there looking at it, realise you are dead. Time will multiply itself forever and now you will understand there is no time.

3. You will then feel a lot of emotions and before you know it enter an afterlife based upon what you believed about life after death whilst you were incarnate as a human. Pearly gates, beautiful gardens, hellfire, nothingness.

4. You will be pulled out of this layer of illusion when you are ready. You will be met by loved ones or spirit guides who will review your life on Earth with you, in order to gain deep understanding. You will feel every interaction from everyone the standpoint of everyone you have interacted with.

5. You will then be allowed to be one with God. You will know what it mean to be infinite. The Divine Matrix. Everything. You will feel everything infinitely. Pure emotion beyond imagination. Ecstasy and pain and terror and horniness and love you never thought imaginable. You will understand how everything is an interconnected sea of meaning.

You will understand everything.

And you will go insane.

Just when you think you can take no more the sea of infinite chaos will stop, angels will wait with baited breath, you will hear a pin drop in Heaven.

And God will ask you the most Sacred Question.

Do you want to go back?

And you, understanding it all will whisper, with a tear in your eye

Yes.

All suicide will do is form a reality of pain for the people you love. You will relive it all.

So stay. You have no idea how loved and worthy you are. How you have so much to give the world. How necessary you are to all creation.

It's about expanding the boundaries of the self.
The first step is to learn to journal in an effective way.
At the end of the day, keep a conscious registry of the day.
How was every hour spent?
What was good, what wasn't?
Did you work towards your goals? How much? In what way?
How did you feel?

Each journal and each individual is distinct.
If you seek muscles you will measure something different than someone who seeks knowledge.
They will have distinct goals.

The dedicated work of journaling will assist in the development of a second consciousness, a mind above the mind that observes and logs, measures and compares.

While endeavoring in this task, there is a thought to keep in mind;
"What changes not?"

>>33623369
Hello, I'm here to take your journaling method to the next level by turning it into an auto-evolutionary self-help methodology.

>What the problem is?

Our conscious intention competes with a whole lot of competing desires and emotional garbage that can lead us to procrastinate, slack off, and get trapped in bad habits. To get out of this, we must make our thought-processes concrete so as to strengthen our conscious intention, and the way to do this is the power of writing.

The method is simple: question, thought, action. Start by asking questions such as "how am I feeling?" and "what do I need to do?" In your journal explore different options and weigh their benefits, and continue to reason until you arrive at a singular action to perform (or in the case of emotional self-analysis, a resolution.) You will know when you are finished because you will almost automatically close the notebook and perform the task, having 100% convinced yourself to do it.

When you have finished your task, go back to your notebook and record your "experimental results." You successfully acted by conscious intention using reason and inquiry, therefore you should feel good about yourself. Now plug this motivational energy back into the process again resulting in another task, and another task, in an unbroken chain of question -> thought -> action. As you do this you will continually feel more confident and better about yourself, which reinforces the process even more. Inertia to act by your conscious intention will disappear.

Eventually after maybe a few weeks you won't need to use the notebook so much because you will have baked this process into your consciousness, and do it automatically.

And from the earth there will spring forth a terrible brood of beings, a brood of automata of an order of existence lying between the mineral and the plant kingdoms, and possessed of an overwhelming power of intellect.

Anyway, here's my dark secrets:
Eat a balanced diet (no more than 20% grains). Try to eat one gram of protein per body weight per day. It's good for muscles and bones.

>>33595834
If you want to progress further in this, you will have to work on your fear response. Fear is such a disruption to the process of going OOB. Visual sensations such as the one you're posting are also present in feinting episodes. The vibrations are also part of many people's response.

So, take heart: you have good potential to regularly go OOB, but you're going to want to work out your fear response. OOB is probably the most harmless thing you can do as a mind, precisely because what you know of harm is explicitly linked to the physical material of the body. So... nothing is going to hurt you, you're not going to get stuck in a strange place, and you are likely to experience something that fundamentally encourages your growth beyond limits you've unwittingly created for yourself.

>>33619241
>All right mr funny, enlighten this thread with the precious wisdom you've got from his later books, then.
Just do drugs bro you'll figure it all out.
The first 2 books are basically just Don Juan feeding Carlos lots of drugs to blow his mind. This is discussed in the later books where Don Juan basically admits he was just fucking with Carlos and the real teachings can't be achieved by simply imbibing entheogenic substances, though it is one way to start down the road of learning.
Journey to Ixtlan, Carlos's 3rd book, introduces Don Genaro. I do agree with >>33603515 that the best part of the whole series is Don Gernaro describing his journey to Ixtlan, but I pretty much like all the books.
Each book in the series after the 2nd introduces new interesting and nuanced characters. Essentially each book takes a step back from the previous book and reveals a bigger picture of what's really going on with Don Juan and his teachings. Whether fact or fiction, any literature that can consistently pull off the trick of adding new depth and perspective with each installment, revealing a more complex and interwoven world is great writing in my opinion. Carlos definitely pulls off this feat in my opinion. It's something that the reader has to experience for himself. Explaining ruins the consistent reveals of what's really going on with Don Juan and his teachings that regularly occur when reading the next book in the series. Read each one until you get to The Eagle's Gift and you will understand what I'm talking about and I don't think you will be disappointed.
